bibl.title: Letter from George T. Wescott to Henry Rose Carter, February 14, 1918

div1.p: Wescott thanks Carter for the care he administered to his son.

div1.head: Letter from George T. Wescott to Henry Rose Carter, February 14, 1918
div1.opener:
Manteo, N.C.
February14, 1918.
Dr. H.R. Carter,
Asst. Surgeon General, U.S.P.H.S.
Baltimore, Maryland.
Sir:-
div1.p:
Our entire family want to heartely thank you for the kindness
that you showed George T. Westcott, during his stay at the Marine
Hospital, Baltimore, Md. We appreciate it more than words can express,
every thing that you did for him.

We have learned from him that it was thro your power that he was sent
home to us, even in his condition, we are of your opinion that he will
be better off at home, where he can receive the necessary needs that
perhaps, may be of some benefit to him, physicaly and mentily.

We again thank you, and pray God's blessings upon you and your family,
and with our very best wishes for your health happiness and prosperity
we beg to be your friends,
